Uses of Class
mayflower.Actor

    • Uses of Actor in mayflower

      Subclasses of Actor in mayflower 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Text 
      Methods in mayflower that return Actor 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Actor Stage.getActorAt(int x, int y)
      Return the Actor on this Stage that is touching (x, y)
      Actor[] Stage.getActors()
      Return an array of all the Actors on this Stage
      Actor[] Stage.getActorsAt(int x, int y)
      Return all Actors on this Stage that are touching (x, y)
      Actor[] Actor.getTouching()
      Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor
      Actor[] Actor.getTouching(int offx, int offy)
      Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor if the Actor were shifted by the specified offset
      Actor[] Actor.getTouching(java.lang.String direction)
      Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor if the Actor were shifted 1 pixel in the specified direction: North, South, East, or West
      Actor Actor.getTouchingAtOffset(int dx, int dy)
      Return an Actor that is touching the point (x + dx, y + dy) where (x, y) is the location of this Actor
      Methods in mayflower with parameters of type Actor 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Stage.addActor(Actor a, int x, int y)
      Add Actor a to this Stage at the location (x, y)
      boolean Actor.isTouching(Actor a)
      Checks if this Actor is touching Actor a
      boolean Actor.isTouching(int offx, int offy, Actor a)
      Checks if this Actor is touching Actor a if it were shifted by (offx, offy)
      boolean Actor.isTouching(java.lang.String direction, Actor a)
      Checks if this Actor is touching Actor a if it were shifted by 1 pixel in the specified direction
      void Stage.removeActor(Actor a)
      Remove Actor a from this Stage
